sub_title: Senior Fire Officer bij ADNOC Refining

profile_positions.description:
• Commands on scene activities of Central Fire Brigade (CFB), auxiliary firefighters and mutual aid resources during Ruwais Industrial Area (RIA) Tier 2 and Tier 3 emergencies.
• Verifies and audits by fire drill evaluations the required level of professional competency of subordinates for safely and efficiently performing all firefighting and rescue activities.
• Develops SOP and work instructions pertaining to CFB activities if requested/required.
• Verifies the required level of emergency preparedness/readiness across 5 fire stations during the assigned shift duty.
• The highest CFB authority during the silent hours.
profile_positions.title: Senior Fire Officer

profile_positions.description:
• Supervise and direct the activities of a shift team of fire fighters involved in fire fighting control measures, rescue and medical emergencies.
• Implement all shift team activities, supervise all testing, inspection and repair of all fire and life support equipment, BA, portable fire extinguishers and the testing and maintenance of a range of fire fighting vehicles, systems and equipment ensuring equipment and shift manning requirements are met at all times.
• Maintain all records associated with shift team activities.
• Implement and promote the company health, safety and environmental policy, ensuring by appropriate monitoring and review, that all work is performed in a safe and environmentally sound manner.
•Plan, direct and actively participate in the ongoing training of employees, directing the preparation of structured development programs and monitoring progress.
•Perform any other related duties as and when required.
profile_positions.title: Fire Officer

profile_positions.description:
• Playing a pivotal Operational Supervisor role as a member of a multi-cultural Emergency Response team comprising seven different nationalities including mentoring and training the Fire Crew which were Afghan Nationals.
• Ensuring the overall efficiency and productivity of the crew during the 24 Hr shift, ensuring that routine and responsive tasks are completed safely and on time.
• Providing a prompt and appropriate response to any emergencies that may arise, including aircraft incidents, structural fires, alarm activations, vehicle accidents, medical calls and hazardous materials incidents.
• Controlling the schedule for the crew to ensure sufficient cover at all times to Stanag Cat 9 & or ICAO Cat 9 Requirements, as well as conducting drills and training classes to equip staff with the necessary skills and capabilities required to deal with any Incident within the Airfield, Structural, Hazmat, Vehicle Incident response Areas including any incidents involving attacks IED's, VBIED's, Rocket Attacks etc.
• Carrying out regular fire safety visits to buildings, office complexes and Bulk Fuel storage areas (7.5 million Ltrs) with responsibility for ensuring that extinguishers and all ancillary fire equipment are in an operational state of readiness at all times.
profile_positions.title: Fire Crew Leader

profile_positions.description:
• Coordinating the activities of all crew members and ensuring that adequate manning levels are maintained during operational hours, presenting reports at weekly officers meetings.
• Deputizing in absence of the watch commander to ensure airport category requirements were met at all times and ensuring continuity of management of the duty watches.
• Responsible for ensuring that all crew members are fully trained to perform their roles safely and effectively in accordance with regulations.
• Overseeing the completion of daily inspections on all vehicles and equipment, logging and reporting faults and facilitating their swift resolution.
profile_positions.title: Fire Crew Leader, ass. Fire Officer
